facts.text: Appellant brought a suit for redemption of certain mortgaged property.

Preliminary decree passed on February 3, 1954, specifying amount due as principal and interest upto a certain date, future interest at three per cent per annum on a certain sum from that date till realisation, parties to bear own costs, payment on or before July 15, 1964 or extended time, if not paid final decree for foreclosure.
Trial court extended time for payment upto August 15, 1954 on appellant's prayer.
Appellant applied to High Court to stay trial court's order to deposit by August 15, 1954 till disposal of appeal.
High Court on July 26, 1954 ordered stay if appellant undertook to pay nine per cent per annum interest instead of three per cent during stay period.
Appellant gave undertaking to trial court on August 7, 1954 to pay nine per cent simple interest during stay, stay came into force, no deposit by August 15, 1954.
High Court on October 16, 1958 dismissed both appeals, preliminary decree confirmed.

Appellant on March 20, 1959 applied to trial court for permission to deposit Rs. 42,204/5/-, permitted on March 27, 1959 without extension of time, question of timeliness to be decided later, notice to respondent.
Respondent on April 8, 1959 objected deposit short, amount due Rs. 46,882/6/6.
Appellant deposited further Rs. 4,590/- on April 9, 1959, prayed for final decree.
Trial court on April 18, 1959 held deposit beyond time, directed final decree for foreclosure in favour of respondent.
Appellant appealed to District Judge, Additional District Judge rejected memorandum as insufficiently stamped.
High Court allowed revision on July 22, 1961, remanded appeal to Additional District Judge.

Additional District Judge on March 23, 1962 allowed appeal, held deposit before final decree within time per O.XXXIV r.8, ordered final decree for appellant, shortage of Rs.88/1/- not ground in trial court, amount per preliminary decree deposited.
Shortage of Rs.88/1/- due to extra six per cent interest for stay period, admitted appellant deposited amount per preliminary decree and more.

Respondent's second appeal to High Court, High Court on March 16, 1963 agreed deposit within time per O.XXXIV r.8 but shortage of Rs.88/1/- meant not entire amount deposited, set aside Additional District Judge order, restored trial court foreclosure decree.
Appellant obtained special leave, appeal to Supreme Court.

legal_issues.text: Whether the appellant had deposited the entire amount due under the preliminary decree before the final decree, particularly whether extra interest undertaken for stay period (six per cent per annum) forms part of amount due under O.XXXIV r.7(1)(c) or subsequent costs, charges, expenses and interests under O.XXXIV r.8(1).

petitioner_arguments.text: Deposited amount strictly due under preliminary decree and something more; shortage only on account of extra six per cent interest due to stay undertaking, which cannot be taken into account for determining if entire amount under preliminary decree deposited.

respondent_arguments.text: Deposit short by Rs.88/1/- (earlier objected Rs.4,000+), entire amount due on date of deposit not paid.

court_reasoning.text: Under O.XXXIV r.8(1), mortgagor can deposit amounts due under O.XXXIV r.7(1) before final foreclosure decree; preliminary decree specified amounts per cls.(b),(c); appellant paid those plus subsequent interest as provided; extra six per cent interest from stay undertaking not part of preliminary decree amount nor 'subsequent costs, charges, expenses and interests' as not adjudged.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Extra interest arose from independent stay order/undertaking, not incorporated in preliminary decree confirmed by High Court; no adjudication of subsequent items.

court_reasoning.text: Court can insist on honouring undertaking before passing final decree, but it does not become part of preliminary decree amount.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Shortage made good soon after Additional District Judge order.

holdings.text: Appellant entitled to final decree as deposited full amount per preliminary decree; extra stay interest not includible.

statutes_cited.name: Code of Civil Procedure
statutes_cited.relevance: Governs contents of preliminary decree, deposit for redemption before final foreclosure decree, and what constitutes amount due including subsequent costs etc.

outcome.summary: Appeal allowed, High Court judgment set aside, Additional District Judge order restored directing final decree in favour of appellant; respondent entitled to withdraw deposited amounts including April 21, 1962 deposit on conditions in that order.
outcome.relief_granted: Final decree for redemption in favour of appellant

key_quotes.text: We are of opinion that this extra amount which was to be paid on account of the undertaking of the appellant for the purpose of stay cannot come within the words in respect of subsequent costs, charges, expenses and interests.
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Core reasoning distinguishing stay interest from decree amounts

key_quotes.text: As we have come to the conclusion that this amount due on account of the undertaking given by the appellant in the matter of stay cannot be taken to be part of the amount due under the preliminary decree, it must be held that the appellant was entitled to a final decree in his favour.
key_quotes.speaker: court
